eng_def: Make less severe, serious, or painful.
sentences: The government launched a new scheme to mitigate the effects of the recession.
Technology can mitigate the problem, but not solve it entirely.

eng_def: Certain to happen; unavoidable.
sentences: It was inevitable that the company would lay off staff.
War was inevitable given the political tension.

eng_def: Open to more than one interpretation; having a double meaning.
sentences: The wording of the agreement is ambiguous.
His role in the project has been ambiguous from the start.

eng_def: Rise and fall irregularly in number or amount.
sentences: Vegetable prices fluctuate according to the season.
His mood seems to fluctuate between optimism and despair.

eng_def: Complete; including all or nearly all elements or aspects of something.
sentences: We offer a comprehensive training program for new employees.
She has a comprehensive knowledge of the subject.

eng_def: Become progressively worse.
sentences: Relations between the countries had deteriorated sharply.
The patient's condition started to deteriorate overnight.

sentences: This is a sample sentence.

eng_def: Sample English definition.
sentences: This is a sample sentence.

eng_def: strong enough to get better quickly after damage, illness, shock, etc
sentences: Growth figures show that the economy is still fairly resilient.

eng_def: US spelling of analyse
sentences: Otomatik örnek bulunamadı.

eng_def: a hard, round fruit with a green or red skin
sentences: a slice of apple

eng_def: extremely good, exciting, or surprising
tr_def: hârikulâde, göz alıcı, muhteşem, şahane, nefes kesici, hayret verici
sentences: a spectacular success
a spectacular view
spectacular scenery

eng_def: to expect a future situation or event
sentences: I don't foresee any problems in the future.
He could foresee the difficulties.

eng_def: to expect something, or to prepare for something before it happens
sentences: to anticipate a problem
[ + that ] We anticipate that prices will fall next year.
I’m not anticipating any trouble.

eng_def: to examine the details of something carefully, in order to understand or explain it
tr_def: analiz etmek, detaylı bir şekilde incelemek
sentences: to analyse information
Blood samples were analysed in the laboratory.

eng_def: friendly and easy to talk to
tr_def: yakınlaşılabilir, iletişim kurulabilir, dost canlısı, yaklaşılabilir
sentences: She’s very approachable, and is always ready to answer any questions you may have.
The village is not approachable by road. You have to take a boat to get there.

eng_def: pretended; not genuine
sentences: He wrote under an assumed name (= not using his real name).

eng_def: An authoritative book, report, etc is respected and considered to be accurate.
tr_def: güvenilir, inanılır, o konuda söz sahibi
sentences: an authoritative guide
an authoritative manner/voice
The website allows you to check the availability of concert tickets.

eng_def: helpful or useful
sentences: Exercise is beneficial to almost everyone.
Regular exercise is beneficial to your health.

eng_def: an idea about what something is like or a way of understanding something
sentences: the conception of a new life
We can have no conception of the size of the universe.

eng_def: (with of) to be composed or made up
sentences: The house consists of six rooms.

eng_def: an area of a country that elects someone to represent it in the government, or the people who live there
sentences: The MP regularly visits the numerous villages in his constituency.

eng_def: to be or form something
tr_def: oluşturmak, teşkil etmek, olmak, bir araya getirmek
sentences: This defeat constitutes a real setback for their championship hopes.
Nuclear waste constitutes a serious danger.

eng_def: all the facts, opinions, situations, etc relating to a particular thing or event
tr_def: bağlam, bir konuya ilişkin tüm unsurlar
sentences: This small battle is important in the context of Scottish history.
Taken out of context, her remark sounded like an insult.

eng_def: a legal agreement between two people or organizations, especially one that involves doing work for a particular amount of money
sentences: The wood contracts in dry weather.
She contracted malaria while living abroad.

eng_def: to make something happen or exist
tr_def: yapmak, oluşturmak, yaratmak, meydan gelmesini sağlamak
sentences: The project will create more than 500 jobs.
The snow created further problems.
The band’s music is not easily definable as it doesn’t fit neatly into any one category.

eng_def: the origin of something, such as a word, from which another form has developed, or the new form itself
sentences: The derivation of this word is Spanish.

eng_def: to give something out to people or places
tr_def: dağıtmak, taksim etmek, paylaştırmak, vermek, tevzi etmek
sentences: The books will be distributed free to local schools.
The company manufactures and distributes computer equipment worldwide.

eng_def: relating to trade, industry, and money
sentences: economic growth
economic policies

eng_def: relating to the environment
sentences: environmental damage
an environmental disaster

eng_def: settled or accepted
sentences: established customs

eng_def: a guess of what a size, value, amount, etc might be
sentences: a rough estimate
Can you give me an estimate for the work?

eng_def: something that makes you believe that something is true or exists
sentences: evidence of global warming
[ + that ] There is no scientific evidence that the drug is addictive.

eng_def: a product that you sell in another country
sentences: Scottish beef exports to Japan
the export of industrial goods

eng_def: the control of how large amounts of money should be spent
sentences: Who put up the finance for the project?
You must learn how to manage your own finances.

eng_def: a plan or method that is used to achieve something
sentences: There's no magic formula for success.
a chemical formula

eng_def: (for sizes of clothes) short for small
sentences: ‘Snake’ begins with an S.

eng_def: designed to be practical or useful and not only attractive
sentences: functional clothing
The system is not yet fully functional.

eng_def: If someone or something is identifiable, you can recognize them and say or prove who or what they are.
sentences: clearly/readily identifiable

eng_def: to show that something exists or is likely to be true
sentences: [ + (that) ] Recent evidence indicates that the skeleton is about 3 million years old.
He has indicated his intention to resign.

eng_def: an explanation or opinion of what something means
sentences: traditional interpretations of the Bible
a beautiful interpretation of Swan Lake

eng_def: short for have
sentences: I've already eaten.

eng_def: the fourth letter of the English alphabet
sentences: ‘Dog’ begins with a D.
The next note you should play is a D.

eng_def: to do things and be part of an activity or event
sentences: How did you get involved in acting?
She got involved with a boy from college.

eng_def: an important subject or problem that people are discussing
sentences: the issues of race and social class
political issues

eng_def: US spelling of labour
not allowed by law
sentences: illegal drugs/weapons
[ + to do sth ] It is illegal to sell cigarettes to anyone under 16.

eng_def: If a government legislates, it makes a new law.
sentences: We believe it is possible to legislate against racism.
It's hard to legislate for (= make a law that will protect) the ownership of an idea.

eng_def: more than half of a group of people or things
sentences: The majority of people in this country own their houses.
The vast majority of smokers claim they would like to give up.

eng_def: careful and well organized, using a plan or system
tr_def: bir yöntem dahilinde yapılmış, planlı, sistemli
sentences: a methodical researcher
a methodical search

eng_def: to happen, often without being planned
sentences: According to the police, the shooting occurred at about 12.30 a.m.
Minerals occur naturally in the Earth's crust.

eng_def: an amount of something, expressed as a number out of 100
sentences: The percentage of women who work has risen steadily.
The percentage of people who are left-handed is small - only about 10%.

eng_def: happening regularly
sentences: Our sales team makes periodic trips to Asia.
He suffers from periodic fits of depression.

eng_def: showing strong beliefs about what is right and wrong
(of food) treated in a special way
sentences: processed cheese/peas

eng_def: to need or demand something
tr_def: istemek, gerekmek; gereksinim duymak; talep etmek
sentences: Training to be a doctor requires a lot of hard work.
[ + that ] A recent law requires that all programmes are censored.

eng_def: detailed study of a subject in order to discover new information
sentences: research into language development
They are doing research into the effects of passive smoking.

eng_def: to say or do something as an answer or reaction to something that has been said or done
sentences: [ + by + doing sth ] The government has responded by sending food and medical supplies to the region.
How quickly did the police respond to the call?

eng_def: not important or large enough to consider or worry about
sentences: insignificant differences
They paid me an insignificant sum of money.

eng_def: the 25th letter of the English alphabet
sentences: ‘Yacht’ begins with a Y
sandy

eng_def: different
sentences: Her hair is not dissimilar to yours (= is similar to yours).
The two cases are not dissimilar.

eng_def: for a particular reason, purpose, etc
sentences: They're designed specifically for children.
[ + to do sth ] She bought it specifically to wear at the wedding.

eng_def: to organize a system or organization in a new way
tr_def: yeniden düzenlemek, çeki düzen vermek, düzeltmek

eng_def: based on the ideas that relate to a subject, not the practical uses of that subject
sentences: theoretical physics
an interesting theoretical approach to the issue

eng_def: unchanging; not variable
sentences: She followed an invariable daily routine.

eng_def: something that is a slightly different form from the usual one
sentences: There are several variants of the virus.
spelling variants
an achievable aim/goal/target

eng_def: to get something
sentences: I managed to acquire a copy of the report.
His family acquired (= bought) the property in 1985.

eng_def: someone who helps to manage an organization
sentences: college/university administrators

eng_def: behaving or speaking in a way that is not natural or sincere
tr_def: samimi ve alışılmış olmayan biçimde konuşan veya davranan
sentences: an affected manner

eng_def: help
sentences: financial/medical assistance
Can I be of any assistance? (= Can I help you?)

eng_def: a group of people or things of a similar type
sentences: Our customers fall into two main categories: retired people and housewives.
Various categories of goods were on sale.

eng_def: an official group of people who have been chosen to find out about something and say what they think should be done about it
sentences: The staff receive 5% commission on everything that they sell.
Many salesmen work on commission.

eng_def: the quality of being complex
sentences: The complexity of the issue should not be underestimated.
the complexities of the English language

eng_def: to end something such as a meeting, speech, or piece of writing by doing or saying one last thing
sentences: The concert concluded with a firework display.
I would like to conclude by thanking you all for attending.

eng_def: the way someone behaves
sentences: a code of conduct (= rules about how to behave)
He was criticized for his conduct of the inquiry.

eng_def: the result of an action or situation, especially a bad result
sentences: The ship capsized, with disastrous consequences.
If you make him angry, you'll have to suffer the consequences.

eng_def: to build something from several parts
sentences: The building was constructed in 1930.
They are planning to construct a new supermarket near our house.

eng_def: to create a description of a past event using all the information that you have
sentences: The police tried to reconstruct the crime using evidence found at the scene.
The police are trying to reconstruct the crime.

eng_def: to use something such as a product, energy, or fuel
sentences: These lights don't consume much electricity.
She was a dancer consumed by ambition.

eng_def: a way of buying something in which you arrange to pay for it at a later time
sentences: We offer interest-free credit on all new cars.
He bought most of the furniture on credit.

eng_def: relating to the habits, traditions, and beliefs of a society
tr_def: kültürel, toplumun inanç, gelenek ve alışkanlıklarına ilişkin
sentences: cultural diversity/identity
cultural events

eng_def: the way in which something is planned and made
sentences: There was a fault in the design of the aircraft.
Engineers are working on the new designs.

eng_def: a difference between two similar things
sentences: the distinction between spoken and written language
wines of distinction

eng_def: to consider one thing to be the same as or equal to another thing
sentences: Many people equate wealth with happiness.
He equates money with happiness.

eng_def: to consider or study something carefully and decide how good or bad it is
sentences: It is difficult to evaluate him as a writer.
If x = 1 and y = 2 we can evaluate x2 + y2.

eng_def: a typical quality, or important part of something
sentences: The town's main features are its beautiful mosque and ancient marketplace.
This phone has several new features.

eng_def: to make a final and certain decision about a plan, date, etc
tr_def: bitirmek, sona erdirmek, son şeklini vermek
sentences: to finalize arrangements/details
We must finalize the arrangements by Friday.

eng_def: If you focus a camera or something else that you look through, you make small changes to it until you can see something clearly.
sentences: Give your eyes time to focus in the darkness.
the focus of our attention

eng_def: the effect that a person, event, or situation has on someone or something
sentences: Latino singers have had a major impact on pop music this year.
The impact of the collision threw her out of the van.

eng_def: hurt
sentences: Fortunately, no one was seriously injured in the accident.
The injured (people) were all taken to hospital after the accident.

eng_def: an organization where people do a particular kind of scientific, educational, or social work
sentences: the Massachusetts Institute of Technology
Major reforms were instituted in the company's finance department.

eng_def: to give money to a bank, business, etc, or buy something, because you hope to get a profit
sentences: He's invested over a million euros in the city's waterfront restoration project.
I think she invests too much time and energy in her career.

eng_def: to make a situation or activity continue in the same way
sentences: The army has been brought in to maintain order in the region.
A large house is very expensive to maintain.

eng_def: different from what is normal or usual, in a way that is strange or dangerous
sentences: abnormal behaviour/weather
They found abnormal levels of lead in the water.

eng_def: written abbreviation for gram (= a unit for measuring weight)
sentences: ‘Gorilla’ begins with a G.
The next note is a G.

eng_def: (opposite unobtainable)
sentences: easily obtainable details

eng_def: someone who is involved in an activity
sentences: All participants finishing the race will receive a medal.
the participants in the Olympic Games

eng_def: to think of something or someone in a particular way
sentences: [ often passive ] The British are often perceived as being very formal.
We perceived a faint light in the distance.

eng_def: to buy something
sentences: Tickets must be purchased two weeks in advance.
the illegal purchase of guns

eng_def: a group of different things of the same general type
sentences: a range of colours/patterns
We discussed a wide range of subjects.

eng_def: relating to a region (= particular area in a country)
sentences: a regional dialect/newspaper
regional variations in speech

eng_def: to remove national or local government controls from a business
tr_def: bir işten ulusal veya bölgesel hükümetin kontrolünü kaldırmak
sentences: The government plans to deregulate the banking industry.

eng_def: to live somewhere
sentences: My sister currently resides in Seattle.
He now resides abroad.

eng_def: controlled or limited
sentences: They do good food but the choice is fairly restricted.
a restricted space

eng_def: having no confidence in yourself and what you can do
sentences: a shy, insecure teenager
Many of our staff are worried because their jobs are insecure.

eng_def: abbreviation for Accident and Emergency the part of a hospital where people go when they are injured or sick and need treatment quickly
tr_def: acil servis, kazalar için acil servis bölümü

eng_def: to try to find or get something
sentences: to seek advice/a solution
[ + to do sth ] They are seeking to change the rules.

eng_def: to choose someone or something
sentences: We've selected three candidates.
a select group

eng_def: helping to achieve a plan, usually in business or politics
sentences: strategic planning
strategic weapons

eng_def: an examination of people's opinions or behaviour made by asking people questions
sentences: Holidays in the UK are becoming more popular, according to a recent survey.
The bank have refused a loan until we've had a survey done on the property.

eng_def: the written words in a book, magazine, etc, not the pictures
sentences: a page of text
First the text was printed, then the drawings added.

eng_def: that can be transferred from one place or person to another
sentences: This ticket is not transferable (= may not be used except by the person to whom it is issued).

eng_def: used to give a second possibility
tr_def: alternatif olarak, bir başka olasılık olarak
sentences: We could go there by train or, alternatively, I could drive us.
Do you want to come with us in the car? Alternatively, we could meet you somewhere in town.

eng_def: a spoken description of an event on the radio or television while the event is happening
sentences: the football commentary
a commentary on American culture

eng_def: to pay someone money because you are responsible for injuring them or damaging something
tr_def: tazmin etmek, zararını karşılamak, tazminat ödemek, telafi etmek
sentences: Victims of the crash will be compensated for their injuries.
Nothing will ever compensate for his lost childhood.

eng_def: a situation in which all the people in a group agree about something
tr_def: ortak mutabakat, genel görüş, oy birliği
sentences: to reach a consensus
The general consensus is that we should wait and see what happens.
the constancy of the sugar content of the blood under normal conditions

eng_def: to control something by limiting it
tr_def: sınırlayarak kontrol altına almak, kısıtlamak, zorlamak, sınırlamak, baskı uygulamak
sentences: regulations that constrain industry
[ often passive ] I'm constrained by decisions made in the past.

eng_def: to give something, especially money, in order to provide or achieve something together with other people
sentences: I contributed $20 towards Andrea's present.
She contributes to several magazines.

eng_def: to arrange a meeting, or to meet for a meeting
tr_def: topla(n)mak, bir araya gelmek, toplantı yapmak
sentences: The committee convenes three times a year.
The President decided to convene a meeting.

eng_def: to make different people or things work together effectively, or to organize all the different parts of an activity
tr_def: etken çalışmayı düzenlemek, ayarlamak; koordine etmek, birlikte çalışmayı sağlamak/yürütmek
sentences: My manager is coordinating the new project.
In swimming the movement of one’s arms and legs must be coordinated.

eng_def: the most important part of a system or principle
sentences: core values
Better health care was at the core of the senator's campaign.

eng_def: to be the same or very similar
sentences: The newspaper story does not correspond with/to what really happened.
A bird’s wing corresponds to the arm and hand in humans.

eng_def: to decide that something is true using the available information
tr_def: var olan bilgiyi kullanarak bir sonuca varmak, sonuç çıkarmak
sentences: [ + (that) ] From the contents of his shopping basket, I deduced that he was single.
From the height of the sun, I deduced that it was about ten o’clock.

eng_def: Something that is demonstrable can be shown to exist or be true.
sentences: a demonstrable fact

eng_def: pieces of paper containing official information
sentences: In most cases you need to provide supporting documentation to substantiate your claim when applying for a scholarship.
Appropriate documentation of the expenses incurred will be necessary.

eng_def: power, influence, and control
sentences: the company's dominance in the software industry
Has Manchester United’s dominance of English football finally come to an end?

eng_def: to show that something is especially important or needs special attention
sentences: The government is emphasizing the importance of voting in the election.
[ + that ] He emphasized that the driver was not to blame for the accident.

eng_def: to show that something is especially important or needs special attention
sentences: The government is emphasizing the importance of voting in the election.
[ + that ] He emphasized that the driver was not to blame for the accident.

eng_def: to make certain that something is done or happens
sentences: [ + (that) ] Please ensure that all examination papers have your name at the top.
Ensure that your television set is switched off at night.

eng_def: to not allow someone or something to take part in an activity or enter a place
sentences: [ often passive ] Women are still excluded from the club.
The insurance cover excludes particular medical conditions.

eng_def: an amount of money collected, saved, or provided for a purpose
sentences: a pension fund
The charity closed down due to lack of funds.

eng_def: having pictures etc
sentences: an illustrated catalogue

eng_def: someone who comes to live in a different country
sentences: The eastern part of the city is inhabited by immigrants.
the immigrant population

eng_def: to suggest or show something, without saying it directly
tr_def: ima etmek, demek istemek, anlamına gelmek; dolaylı anlatmak, ... ın/in işareti olmak
sentences: [ + (that) ] Are you implying that I'm fat?
an implied criticism

eng_def: to talk and do things with other people
sentences: At school, teachers say he interacted well with other students.
We are looking at how these chemicals interact.

eng_def: having a good reason
sentences: justifiable anger
a justifiable reason

eng_def: an amount of a substance covering a surface, or one of several amounts of substance, each on top of the other
sentences: the outer/top layer
Place alternate layers of pasta and meat sauce in a shallow dish.

eng_def: to find the exact position of someone or something
sentences: Police are still trying to locate the suspect.
Both schools are located in the town.

eng_def: maximum (= the largest amount allowed or possible), often used after numbers
sentences: The trip should take 30 minutes max.
He lived life to the max.

eng_def: a part of a group that is less than half of the whole group, often much less
sentences: The violence was caused by a small minority of football supporters.
I voted to accept the proposal, but I was in the minority.

eng_def: to make something lose its effect or value
tr_def: geçersiz kılmak, boşa çıkarmak, etkisiz kılmak

eng_def: someone that you are married to or having a sexual relationship with
sentences: sexual partners
Are partners invited to the office dinner?

eng_def: someone who studies or writes about the meaning of life
sentences: Rousseau was a famous philosopher.

eng_def: If two amounts are proportionate, they change at the same rate so that the relationship between them does not change.
sentences: His success was proportionate to his efforts.
Are her wages really proportionate to the amount of work she does?

eng_def: to prepare and print a book, newspaper, magazine, article, etc so that people can buy it
sentences: [ often passive ] This book is published by Cambridge University Press.
He's published several short stories in national magazines.

eng_def: to say, do, or feel something because of something else that has been said or done
sentences: He reacted angrily to her comments.
My skin reacts to most perfumes.

eng_def: an official list of names
sentences: a register of approved builders
the electoral register
This company has a good reputation for reliability of service.
a coat with a removable hood

eng_def: (of a diagram) showing the main parts of something in a simplified way
sentences: A final means of describing an electric circuit is by use of conventional circuit symbols to provide a schematic diagram of the circuit and its components.

eng_def: sexual activity between people
sentences: to have sex with someone
sex education

eng_def: a change in something
sentences: There has been a dramatic shift in public opinion on this matter.
afternoon/night shift

eng_def: not enough
sentences: insufficient information
[ + to do sth ] Her income is insufficient to support a family.
technological advances/improvements

eng_def: to make invalid
sentences: The High Court invalidated a federal law that banned the Communist party.

eng_def: the right or opportunity to use or see something
sentences: I don't have access to that kind of information.
Do you have Internet access?
Always check the adequacy of the equipment for the job it is supposed to perform.

eng_def: not completely accurate but close
sentences: Do you have an approximate idea of when he's arriving?
These figures are only approximate.

eng_def: caused by something
sentences: A lot of crime is attributable to the use of drugs.

eng_def: written or sent in code
sentences: a coded message/warning

eng_def: a promise or firm decision to do something
sentences: Players must make a commitment to daily training.
He gave a speech affirming the government's commitment to education.

eng_def: the 14th letter of the English alphabet
sentences: ‘Nut’ begins with an N
fish ‘n’ chips

eng_def: using a lot of effort to succeed at one particular thing
sentences: a concentrated effort to finish the work
concentrated tomato puree

eng_def: a large, formal meeting, often lasting a few days, where people discuss their work, politics, subjects they are studying, etc
sentences: the annual sales conference
The conference of heart specialists was held in New York.

eng_def: an obvious difference between two people or things
sentences: The contrast between their lifestyles couldn't be greater.
The busy north coast of the island is in sharp contrast to the peaceful south.

eng_def: a series of events that happen in a particular order and are often repeated
tr_def: dizi, demet, bir seri olaylar zinciri
sentences: the life cycle of a moth
He cycles to work every day.

eng_def: If something is debatable, it is not certain if it is true or not.
sentences: It's debatable whether a university degree will help you in this job.
a debatable point

eng_def: of (a certain number of) dimensions
sentences: a three-dimensional figure

eng_def: to appear from somewhere or come out of somewhere
sentences: A figure emerged from the shadows.
It emerged that she had lied to her employers.

eng_def: not correct
sentences: an erroneous answer
an erroneous statement

eng_def: (even) if; assuming
sentences: Granted that you are right, we will have to move fast.

eng_def: a suggested explanation for something that has not yet been proved to be true
how big or small something is
sentences: It's an area about the size of Oxford.
The size of some of those trees is incredible (= they are very large).
the implementation of a plan

eng_def: to show that someone or something is involved in something bad, especially a crime
sentences: [ often passive ] Two senior officers are implicated in the latest drugs scandal.
The minister resigned after being implicated in the scandal.

eng_def: to officially order that a rule, tax, punishment, etc will happen
sentences: to impose a ban/tax
The judge imposed the death penalty on both men.

eng_def: to become part of a group or society, or to help someone do this
sentences: After a few weeks of training he was fully integrated into the team.
There are plans to integrate the two schools.

eng_def: to try to discover all the facts about something, especially a crime or accident
sentences: He has been questioned by detectives investigating Jenkins' murder.
The police are investigating the crime.

eng_def: a small piece of paper or other material that gives information about the thing it is fixed to
sentences: There should be washing instructions on the label.
He seems to be stuck with the label of 'troublemaker'.

eng_def: someone’s use of a building, room, piece of land etc, or the period of time during which they live or work there
sentences: Early arrivals may leave their luggage until the apartment is ready for occupancy.

eng_def: If something is optional, it is available but you do not have to have it.
sentences: an optional extra
Music is optional at our school.

eng_def: If two or more lines are parallel, the distance between them is the same along all their length.
sentences: The streets are parallel.
Parallel experiments are being conducted in both countries.

eng_def: to gradually start using a new system, process, or law
tr_def: yavaş yavaş başlatmak; aşama aşama uygulamaya koymak; kademe kademe ilerlemek
sentences: The new tax will be phased in over five years.

eng_def: to continue doing something
sentences: [ + doing sth ] The doctors have warned him but he just carries on drinking.
Carry on with your work while I'm gone.

eng_def: the skill and careful attention that trained people are expected to have
sentences: He complained about the lack of professionalism in the company.

eng_def: a carefully planned piece of work that has a particular purpose
sentences: a research project
The new building project will cost $45 million.

eng_def: to encourage something to happen or develop
tr_def: olmasına/gelişmesine destek vermek; yüreklendirmek; cesaret vermek
sentences: to promote good health/peace
The band is promoting their new album.

eng_def: an official decision that is made after a group or organization have voted
sentences: Congress passed a resolution in support of the plan (= voted to support it).
My New Year's resolution is to do more exercise.

eng_def: to continue to keep something
sentences: Will this beauty queen retain her crown?
He finds it difficult to retain information.
statistical data

eng_def: worried and not able to relax
sentences: Tanya's really stressed out about her exams.
I always feel rather stressed when I have to give a speech.

eng_def: a short description that gives the main facts or ideas about something
sentences: He gave a brief summary of what happened.
a summary arrest/execution

eng_def: to increase in level
sentences: rising temperatures
Prices rose by 10 percent.

eng_def: to describe briefly the main facts or ideas of something
sentences: He summarized the arguments.

eng_def: to start work on something that will take a long time or be difficult
sentences: Max has undertaken the task of restoring an old houseboat.
He undertook the job willingly.

eng_def: the people and organizations, especially universities, involved in studying
tr_def: öğrenimle ilgili, bilhassa üniversiteler ve orada çalışan insanlar topluluğu

eng_def: to change something slightly so that it works better, fits better, or is more suitable
sentences: You can adjust the heat using this switch here.
She adjusted her hat in the mirror.

eng_def: to slightly change the words of a document
sentences: [ often passive ] The contract has now been amended.
We will amend the error as soon as possible.

eng_def: the mental state of knowing about something
sentences: Environmental awareness is increasing all the time.
The aim of the campaign is to raise awareness of the dangers of taking illegal drugs.

eng_def: the largest amount or number that a container, building, etc can hold
sentences: The restaurant has a capacity of about 200.
The stadium was filled to capacity (= completely full).

eng_def: something that is difficult and that tests someone's ability or determination
tr_def: birinin yetenek ve kararlılığını ölçen şey, durum
sentences: Finding a decision that pleases everyone is the challenge which now faces the committee.
It was the element of challenge which attracted me to the job.

eng_def: a substance that is a combination of two or more elements
sentences: Water is a compound of hydrogen and oxygen.
a prison compound

eng_def: confused because you have two feelings or opinions about something that are opposite
a company that gives advice on subjects it knows a lot about
sentences: a management/recruitment consultancy

eng_def: to go to a particular person or book to get information or advice
sentences: For more information, consult your travel agent.
Why didn't you consult me about this?

eng_def: a situation in which something becomes less in amount, importance, quality, or strength
sentences: a steady decline in sales/standards
She declined his offer of a lift.

eng_def: a piece of writing or a plan that is not yet in its finished form
sentences: He made several changes to the first draft.
to draft a letter

eng_def: having the necessary equipment or system to use something
tr_def: gerekli alet veya sisteme sahip olan anlamında kullanılan son ek
sentences: Bluetooth-enabled mobile phones
voice-enabled software

eng_def: having or involving a lot of energy
tr_def: canlı, enerji dolu, çalışkan, enerjik, güçlü
sentences: an energetic young woman
Aerobics is too energetic for me.

eng_def: to make people obey a rule or law
sentences: It is the duty of the police to enforce the law.
The new teacher failed to enforce discipline.

eng_def: the way in which living things gradually change and develop over millions of years
sentences: Darwin's theory of evolution
the evolution of language

eng_def: to increase in size or amount, or to make something increase
sentences: We are hoping to expand our range of products.
Electronic services are rapidly expanding to meet demand.

eng_def: having no protection from bad weather
sentences: an exposed cliff
an exposed position high up the mountain.

eng_def: to make something possible or easier
sentences: I will do everything in my power to facilitate the process.

eng_def: to cause something to exist
sentences: to generate income/profit
This film has generated a lot of interest.

eng_def: the use of words or pictures in books, films, paintings, etc to describe ideas or situations
to speak angrily to someone
sentences: She berated him for being late.

eng_def: an official document that allows you to do or have something
sentences: a hunting licence
a marriage licence

eng_def: not based on careful thought
sentences: It would be illogical for them to stop at this stage.
That method of doing things seems illogical to me.

eng_def: small and not important
tr_def: kıyıda köşede kalan, küçük ve önemsiz
sentences: a marginal effect/improvement
a marginal improvement

eng_def: a person's opinions or way of thinking
sentences: I can't understand the mentality of people who hunt animals for fun.
The team needs to develop a winning mentality.

eng_def: a small change to something
sentences: We've made a few modifications to the system.

eng_def: a screen that shows information or pictures, usually connected to a computer
sentences: a colour monitor
a heart monitor

eng_def: a system or group of connected parts
sentences: a rail/road network
a network of cables/tunnels
He considered the problem objectively.

eng_def: to get (oneself) used to unfamiliar surroundings, conditions etc ; orient
sentences: It took a while for me to orientate myself when I first started this job.
The hikers tried to orientate themselves before continuing their walk.

eng_def: not accurate or exact
sentences: an imprecise description
Her directions were so imprecise that we lost our way.

eng_def: relating to the human mind and feelings
sentences: psychological problems

eng_def: If you pursue a plan, activity, or situation, you try to do it or achieve it, usually over a long period of time.
sentences: She decided to pursue a career in television.
The car was pursued by helicopters.

eng_def: to refuse to accept or agree with something
sentences: The United States government rejected the proposal.
I applied to Cambridge University but I was rejected.

eng_def: a lot of changes in a situation or in someone's behaviour so that you do not know what will happen next
sentences: political/mental instability
mental instability

eng_def: a way of doing something that is typical of a particular person, group, place, or period
sentences: a style of painting/writing
She's had her hair cut in a really nice style.

eng_def: someone or something that is used instead of another person or thing
sentences: Margarine can be used as a substitute for butter.
a substitute teacher
Improving the sustainability of the food chain is essential in tackling climate change.

eng_def: representing something
sentences: The blue, white, and red of the French flag are symbolic of liberty, equality, and fraternity.
In the Christian religion, bread and wine are symbolic of Christ’s body and blood.

eng_def: something or someone that you attack, shoot at, try to hit, etc
sentences: It's very difficult to hit a moving target.
Foreign businesses in the region have become a target for terrorist attacks.

eng_def: the quality of being abstract
sentences: the tension between the realism and the abstraction of the painting

eng_def: how correct or exact something is
sentences: The new system should help to improve the accuracy of weather forecasts.
This type of work requires extreme accuracy.

eng_def: to accept that something is true or exists
sentences: [ + (that) ] He acknowledged that there was a problem.
Send a letter acknowledging receipt of his application.

eng_def: to give some time, money, space, etc to be used for a particular purpose
tr_def: ayırmak, pay ayırmak, vermek, tahsis etmek
sentences: The government has promised to allocate extra money for health care.
More police time should be allocated to crime prevention.

eng_def: to give someone a particular job or responsibility
sentences: [ + two objects ] UN troops were assigned the task of rebuilding the hospital.
[ often passive ] The case has been assigned to our most senior officer.

eng_def: to like someone or something very much
tr_def: birine, birşeye bağlanmak, müptelası olmak, çok sevmek
sentences: I've become rather attached to my old car.
I’m very attached to my brother.

eng_def: an interest, experience, or feeling that makes two people feel connected
sentences: A love of opera created a bond between them.
This glue bonds wood and metal in seconds.

eng_def: a quality that speech or writing has when it is short and contains few words
sentences: He is not well known for the brevity of his speeches.

eng_def: the ability or power to do something
sentences: [ + to do sth ] Both players have the capability to win this game.
She certainly has the capability to win another tennis championship.

eng_def: to work together with someone in order to achieve the same aim
sentences: Witnesses are cooperating with detectives.
Several countries are cooperating in the relief effort.

eng_def: (in adverbs) in a particular way
sentences: He’s happily married.
cowardly behaviour

eng_def: to treat someone unfairly because of their sex, race, religion, etc
tr_def: (cinsiyet, ırk, din vb.) ayrım/ayrımcılık yapmak, ayırt etmek
sentences: The company was accused of discriminating against people on the basis of age.
Police dogs are very good at discriminating between different smells.

eng_def: a collection of objects or pictures arranged for people to look at
sentences: a display of children's paintings
Many old aircraft are on display at the museum.
EU member states reacted diversely to the war.

eng_def: to prepare text, film, etc by deciding what to include and making mistakes correct
tr_def: (dergi, gazete, film vb.) basıma, yayına hazırlamak
sentences: He spent six months editing the film.

eng_def: to improve something
tr_def: geliştirmek, katkıda bulunmak, zenginlik katmak, (güç, güzellik, değer vb.) arttırmak
sentences: Winning that award greatly enhanced her reputation.
The book greatly enhanced his reputation.

eng_def: to be more than a particular number or amount
sentences: Sales have exceeded $1 million so far this year.
His expenditure exceeds his income.

eng_def: skill
sentences: the technical expertise of the engineers
professional/technical expertise

eng_def: a group of organizations, countries, regions, etc that have joined together to form a larger organization or government
sentences: the International Tennis Federation
the International Federation of Actors
There is increasing flexibility in the modern workplace.

eng_def: not enough knowledge, understanding, or information about something
sentences: There is still widespread ignorance about the disease.
I was shocked by her total ignorance of world history.

eng_def: an event, especially one that is bad or unusual
sentences: Police are investigating the incident.
There was a strange incident in the supermarket today.

eng_def: used after the name of companies that have been organized in a particular legal way
sentences: They formed their own company, Broadcast Music Incorporated.
The name of our company is ‘Field Services, Incorporated’.

eng_def: an alphabetical list of subjects or names at the end of a book, showing on what page they are found in the text
sentences: Look up 'heart disease' in the index.
the retail price index

eng_def: not confident enough to say or do what you want
sentences: He felt inhibited by the presence of his parents.

eng_def: to make something begin
sentences: [ often passive ] The program was initiated by the state government.
At the age of 50, he was initiated into the priesthood.

eng_def: to officially tell someone to do something
sentences: [ + to do sth ] Staff are instructed not to use the telephones for personal calls.
She is there to instruct people in the safe use of the gym equipment.

eng_def: the ability to learn, understand, and think about things
sentences: a child of low intelligence
military intelligence

eng_def: a formal talk given to a group of people in order to teach them about a subject
sentences: We went to a lecture on Italian art.
Do you know who's giving the lecture this afternoon?

eng_def: someone who goes to live in a different place in order to find work
sentences: migrant labour/workers
The swallow is a summer migrant to Britain.

eng_def: a politician who is responsible for a government department or has an important position in it
sentences: a finance/health minister
a Baptist/Methodist minister

eng_def: to make someone enthusiastic about doing something
tr_def: harekete geçirmek, sevketmek, dürtülemek, güdülemek, motive etmek
sentences: [ + to do sth ] Teaching is all about motivating people to learn.
[ often passive ] Some people are motivated by greed.

eng_def: to happen or exist before something else
tr_def: ...dan/den önce gelmek/olmak; önden gelmek, önünde/önden gitmek
sentences: [ often passive ] The formal ceremony was preceded by a parade.
the preceding months

eng_def: used to say what you think is the likely situation
sentences: Presumably he just forgot to send the letter.
She’s not in her office – presumably she went home early.

eng_def: Irrational feelings and actions are based on your emotions and not on good reasons.
tr_def: mantıksız, saçma, akla dayanmayan, mâkul olmayan, akıl dışı
sentences: irrational behaviour
an irrational fear of flying

eng_def: to give someone a piece of information that is surprising or that was previously secret
sentences: [ + that ] It was revealed in this morning's papers that the couple intend to marry.
His shirt came up at the back, revealing an expanse of white skin.

eng_def: a company that is owned by another larger company
sentences: questions that are subsidiary to the main one.
this firm and its subsidiaries

eng_def: a long, thin piece of plastic that is used to store sound, pictures, or information, or a plastic box containing it
sentences: Can you turn the tape over?
I've got the match on tape.

eng_def: the act of transforming or process of being transformed
sentences: the transformation of water into ice
The event caused a transformation in her character.

eng_def: a vehicle or system of vehicles, such as buses, trains, etc for getting from one place to another
sentences: Bicycles are an efficient and cheap form of transportation.
transportation costs

eng_def: to use something in an effective way
sentences: The vitamins come in a form that is easily utilized by the body.
The extra money is being utilized to buy books for the school library.
the adaptability of animals to habitat change.

eng_def: the part of your life when you are an adult
sentences: Most of the young men leave home when they reach adulthood.

eng_def: to express support for a particular idea or way of doing things
sentences: I certainly wouldn't advocate the use of violence.
He has always been an advocate of stricter gun controls.

eng_def: money, food, or equipment that is given to help a country or group of people
tr_def: insani yardım, para, yiyecek ve malzeme yardımı
sentences: Emergency aid was sent to the flood victims.
aid workers

eng_def: a television or radio station (= broadcasting company)
sentences: an irrigation channel
a channel of communication

eng_def: relating to chemistry or chemicals
sentences: a chemical reaction
chemical weapons

eng_def: serious music by people like Mozart and Stravinsky
sentences: Do you prefer classical music or pop music?
classical and modern dance

eng_def: to consist of particular parts or members
sentences: The orchestra was comprised of amateur and professional musicians.
Women comprise 15% of the police force.

eng_def: an announcement or proof that something is true or certain
sentences: You'll receive written confirmation of your reservation within five days.
She was waiting for confirmation of a university place.

eng_def: a situation in which the appearance, form, or purpose of something is changed
sentences: the country's conversion to democracy
her conversion to Christianity

eng_def: two or a few
sentences: I went to New York with a couple of friends.
The weather has improved over the last couple of weeks.

eng_def: without any doubt
sentences: This book is definitely worth reading.
"Do you want to come?" "Yes, definitely."

eng_def: to understand or notice how two things or people are different from each other
tr_def: ayırmak, ayrımını yapabilmek, farkını ortaya koymak, farkını anlamak
sentences: He can't differentiate between blue and green.
We need to differentiate ourselves from the competition.

eng_def: intended to be used only once and then thrown away
tr_def: kullan at, bir kereye mahsus kullanılan, bir kullanımlık
sentences: a disposable camera/razor
disposable cups/plates

eng_def: to remove something from something, or get rid of something
sentences: The doctor advised me to eliminate salt from my diet.
[ often passive ] She was eliminated after the first round of the tournament.

eng_def: the things that are used for a particular activity or purpose
sentences: kitchen/office equipment
electrical equipment (= equipment that uses electricity)

eng_def: to take something out, especially using force
sentences: The dentist may decide to extract the tooth.
They were not able to extract a confession from her.

eng_def: a piece of text, a picture, or a computer program stored on a computer
tr_def: tek bir isim altında depolanan bilgi bütünü, dosya
sentences: Do you want to download all these files?
The school keeps files on all its pupils.

eng_def: extremely large or great
sentences: She took infinite care with the painting.
God's power is infinite.

eng_def: relating to the whole world
sentences: the global problem of nuclear waste
Pollution is a global problem.

eng_def: a number or letter that shows how good someone's work or performance is
sentences: Steve never studies, but he always gets good grades.
UK Carla got a grade A in German.

eng_def: to promise that something is true or will happen
tr_def: güvence vermek, söz vermek, garanti etmek
sentences: Every child is guaranteed a place at a local school.
[ + (that) ] We can't guarantee that it will arrive in time.
a hierarchical structure

eng_def: based on or relating to a particular set of ideas or beliefs
sentences: ideological conflicts/disagreements
ideological change in the British Conservative Party

eng_def: a fact that you decide is true because of the information that you have
sentences: What inferences can we draw from this?
The inference was that the police knew what was going on, but had ignored it.

eng_def: to put something into something else
sentences: Insert the coin in the slot.
He inserted a new paragraph.

eng_def: to become involved in a situation in order to try to stop a fight, argument, problem, etc
sentences: Government officials refused to intervene in the recent disputes.
[ + to do sth ] The forces intervened to stop the attack.

eng_def: a long way from other places
sentences: an isolated village in the mountains
Kazuo felt very isolated at his new school.

eng_def: something that exists or happens, usually something unusual
sentences: storms, lightning, and other natural phenomena
Road rage seems to be a fairly recent phenomenon.

eng_def: something that is very important and that must be dealt with before other things
sentences: My first/top priority is to find somewhere to live.
His job seems to take priority over everything else.

eng_def: to officially forbid something
sentences: [ often passive ] Smoking is prohibited on most international flights.
[ + from + doing sth ] The new law prohibits people from drinking alcohol in the street.

eng_def: a sentence or phrase that is taken out of a book, poem, or play
sentences: a quotation from Shakespeare/the Bible
Make sure you get a quotation for all the work before they start.

eng_def: to allow a prisoner to be free
sentences: Six hostages were released shortly before midday.
Release the handle.

eng_def: Something that is irreversible cannot be changed back to how it was before.
tr_def: değiştirilemez, düzeltilemez, iptal edilemez, eski haline getirilemez
sentences: Smoking has caused irreversible damage to his lungs.
an irreversible decision

eng_def: artificial; having the appearance of
sentences: simulated leather
a simulated accident

eng_def: the act of accepting that someone has complete control over you
tr_def: boyun eğme, kendini teslim etme, razı olma; hizaya/yola gelme
sentences: They tried to starve her into submission.
The deadline for submissions is 29 April.

eng_def: a number of similar events or people that happen, exist, etc after each other
tr_def: art arda gelen, peşi sıra olan
sentences: to suffer a succession of injuries
a succession of boyfriends

eng_def: the fact of continuing to live or exist, especially after a difficult or dangerous situation
sentences: Flood victims had to fight for survival.
the problem of survival in sub-zero temperatures

eng_def: relating to things that are happening now
sentences: topical news

eng_def: the process of broadcasting something by radio, television, etc, or something that is broadcast
sentences: radio/satellite transmission
There is still a risk of transmission of the virus through infected water.

eng_def: different from everyone and everything else
sentences: Everyone's fingerprints are unique.
a unique opportunity
He joined the army voluntarily.

eng_def: having been left without any intention of returning to or reclaiming
sentences: The police found the abandoned vehicle.
an abandoned factory

eng_def: to go somewhere with someone
sentences: We accompanied her back to her hotel.
The teachers' book is accompanied by a CD.

eng_def: to increase in amount over a period of time, or to make something increase over a period of time
sentences: The chemicals accumulate in your body.
to accumulate wealth/debts

eng_def: the state of having more than one possible meaning
tr_def: anlam kargaşası, çok anlamlılık, karmaşa, anlaşılmazlık
sentences: Legal documents must be free of ambiguity.
the ambiguity of the poem’s ending

eng_def: to add something to the end of a written text
sentences: A bibliography has been appended to the end of the paper.

eng_def: large or important enough to be noticed
tr_def: gereğinden büyük, kayda değer, fark edilebilen
sentences: There's an appreciable difference in temperatures between the two regions.
There has been an appreciable increase in house prices.
The lottery numbers are chosen arbitrarily.

eng_def: working by automation
sentences: a fully automated assembly line

eng_def: showing unfair support for or opposition to someone or something because of your personal opinions
sentences: to be biased against/towards younger workers
a biased decision

eng_def: a drawing that shows information in a simple way, often using lines and curves to show amounts
sentences: a sales chart
This song entered the charts at number 8.
This statement needs clarification.

eng_def: Things that are complementary are good or attractive together.
sentences: complementary colours/flavours
The clinic offers complementary therapies such as homeopathy.

eng_def: small drops of water in the air that make it difficult to see objects which are not near
sentences: Gradually the mist cleared and the sun began to shine.
The hills are covered in thick mist.

eng_def: If two things that are said or written about something contradict each other, they are so different that they cannot both be true.
tr_def: çelişmek, aykırı olmak, uyuşmamak, tezat yaratmak
sentences: His account of the accident contradicts the official government report.
He said we were all happy at work, and nobody dared to contradict him.

eng_def: to do something in a different way from what is usual or expected
tr_def: yoldan çıkmak, sapmak, farklı bir yöne gitmek
sentences: The aircraft deviated from its original flight plan.
She refuses to deviate from her routine.

eng_def: to take the place of someone or something
sentences: Many of these workers will be displaced by modern technology.
The earthquake displaced thousands of people.

eng_def: a play in a theatre or on television or radio
sentences: a historical drama
modern drama

eng_def: a possible happening
sentences: We are ready for all eventualities.

eng_def: to show objects such as paintings to the public
sentences: She's exhibiting her roses at the local flower show.
The crew exhibited great courage when the plane crashed.

eng_def: to keep changing, especially in level or amount
sentences: Oil prices have fluctuated wildly in recent weeks.
fluctuations in house prices

eng_def: to emphasize something or make people notice something
sentences: to highlight a problem/danger
The report highlights the need for stricter regulations.

eng_def: to persuade someone do something
sentences: [ + to do sth ] Nothing would induce me to marry that man!
High doses of the drug may induce depression.
the inevitability of the whole sorry situation

eng_def: to officially visit a building or organization, in order to check that everything is correct and legal
sentences: Schools will be inspected regularly to maintain standards.
Clara inspected her make-up in the mirror.

eng_def: very much
sentences: I dislike that sort of behaviour/behavior intensely.

eng_def: to control someone or something in a clever way so that they do what you want them to do
sentences: She knows how to manipulate the press.
the manipulation of language

eng_def: If one thing offsets another thing, it has the opposite effect and so creates a more balanced situation.
sentences: [ often passive ] The costs have been offset by savings in other areas.

eng_def: Prospective buyers, employers, parents, etc are not yet buyers, employers, parents, etc but are expected to be in the future.

sentences: a radically different approach
The lottery numbers are randomly chosen by a machine.

eng_def: to make an existing opinion or idea stronger
tr_def: güçlendirmek, desteklemek, daha güçlü hâle getirmek, pekiştirmek
sentences: to reinforce a view/feeling
a security door reinforced by steel bars
The building was closed for restoration(s).

eng_def: to change something so that it is more accurate
sentences: a revised edition of the book
This dictionary has been completely revised.

eng_def: to agree a new and later date for something to happen
tr_def: yeniden kararlaştırmak; tekrar başka bir tarih belirlemek

eng_def: a building where you can get onto an aircraft, bus, or ship
sentences: a terminal building
an office with several terminals

eng_def: the condition of being uniform
sentences: The houses in the street had no uniformity of appearance.

eng_def: to have enough space somewhere for a number of things or people
tr_def: eşya veya insanlar için yeteri kadar yer, alan sağlamak
sentences: We need more roads to accommodate the increase in traffic.
He requires special equipment and, where possible, we've accommodated those needs.

eng_def: a comparison that shows how two things are similar
tr_def: iki şeyin birbirinden nasıl farklı olduğunu gösteren mukayese
sentences: She draws an analogy between life's events and a game of chance.
She drew an analogy between a computer virus and the spread of a disease.

eng_def: to expect something, or to prepare for something before it happens
sentences: to anticipate a problem
[ + that ] We anticipate that prices will fall next year.

eng_def: a promise
tr_def: vaat, söz, güvence, sigorta, garanti, teminat
sentences: [ + that ] He gave us an assurance that it would not happen again.
She spoke with calm assurance.

eng_def: to achieve something, especially after a lot of work
sentences: She's attained a high level of fitness.
He attained all his ambitions.

eng_def: to stop
sentences: [ + doing sth ] He ordered his men to cease firing.
[ + to do sth ] Her behaviour never ceases to amaze me.
the coherence of his ideas/thoughts

eng_def: to happen at the same time as something else
tr_def: tesadüf etmek, aynı zamana rastgelmek, çakışmak
sentences: The band's American tour coincided with the release of their second album.
Her arrival coincided with his departure.

eng_def: to begin something
sentences: the conference commenced with a speech by the president.
In our labs we have tested all of the most popular anti-virus software for compatibility with our products.

eng_def: A confined space is very small.
sentences: She was confined to bed with a cold.
a confined space

eng_def: causing a lot of disagreement or argument
tr_def: tartışmalı, tartışmaya açık, nizalı, uyuşmazlık yaratan
sentences: a controversial decision/issue
His new book is very controversial.

eng_def: loving or caring very much about someone or something
tr_def: kendini vakfetmiş/adamış, bağlı, saçını süpürge eden
sentences: She's absolutely devoted to her grandchildren.
a devoted friend

eng_def: (opposite undiminished)
to change the shape, sound, or appearance of something so that it seems strange
tr_def: bozmak, tahrif etmek, çarpıtmak, saptırmak, biçimini bozmak
sentences: It's a bad recording - the microphone distorted our voices.
Newspapers distorted the truth about their marriage.

eng_def: If soil, stone, etc erodes or is eroded, it is gradually damaged and removed by the sea, rain, or wind.
sentences: [ often passive ] The coastline is slowly being eroded by the sea.
Reports of corruption have eroded people's confidence in the police.

eng_def: relating to what is right or wrong
sentences: The book raises some serious ethical questions.
He dealt with this case in a completely professional and ethical manner.

eng_def: the way something is designed, arranged, or produced
sentences: This year's event will have a new format.
Do you know how to format a blank disk?

eng_def: to start an organization, especially by providing money
sentences: The company was founded in 1861.
[ often passive ] a society founded on principles of equality

eng_def: by hand
sentences: You have to operate this sewing-machine manually – it is not electric.

eng_def: not behaving in a way that is as wise and calm as people expect from someone your age
sentences: Some of the boys are quite immature for their age.
immature cells

eng_def: to try to find a solution between two or more people who disagree about something
sentences: Negotiators were called in to mediate between the two sides.
The United States is trying to mediate (in the dispute) between these two countries.

eng_def: If two subjects or activities overlap, they are the same in some way.
sentences: Although our job titles are different, our responsibilities overlap quite a lot.
The pieces of cloth overlapped (each other).

eng_def: A refined substance has been made more pure by removing other substances from it.
sentences: refined sugar
a refined method
I play golf for relaxation.
Golf is one of my favourite relaxations.

eng_def: calm and not showing emotions
sentences: I was expecting him to be furious but he was very restrained.

eng_def: completely different from what was done before
sentences: The twentieth century has brought about revolutionary changes in our lifestyles.
a revolutionary movement

eng_def: to defeat someone completely
sentences: an election rout
The rebels were completely routed by the government troops.

eng_def: a subject or area of knowledge, work, etc
sentences: the political sphere

eng_def: less important or lower in rank
sentences: a subordinate position/role
An individual's needs are subordinate to those of the group.

eng_def: added to something
sentences: supplementary materials
supplementary material

eng_def: to stop something happening for a short time
tr_def: ertelemek, tehir etmek, tatil etmek, askıya almak, dondurmak
sentences: The semifinal was suspended because of bad weather.
[ often passive ] A light bulb was suspended from the ceiling.

eng_def: to join someone and work together with them to do something
tr_def: ekip oluşturmak, grup kurmak, bir araya gelmek
sentences: I teamed up with Brendan for the doubles tournament.
They teamed up with another family to rent a house for the holidays.

eng_def: to make something begin to happen
sentences: His arrest triggered mass protests.
Stress can be a trigger for many illnesses.

eng_def: a process in which two or more countries join together and become one country
sentences: the unification of East and West Germany

eng_def: to not obey a law, rule, or agreement
sentences: Countries that violate international law will be dealt with severely.
They were accused of violating human rights.

eng_def: to join other people somewhere to make a group, or to bring people together into a group
tr_def: toplanmak, bir araya gelmek, grup oluşturmak
sentences: They assembled in the meeting room after lunch.
A crowd had assembled in the hall.

eng_def: When someone collapses, they fall down, usually because they are sick or weak.
sentences: He collapsed and died of a heart attack.
The roof collapsed under the weight of snow.

eng_def: a recording, book, or film containing a collection of things from many different recordings, books, or films
tr_def: derleme, bir araya getirme, derleme eser
sentences: The album is a compilation of his greatest hits.

eng_def: possible to imagine or to believe
tr_def: akla gelebilecek, mümkün olan, aklın alabileceği
sentences: every conceivable kind of fruit
[ + (that) ] It is just conceivable that the hospital made a mistake.

eng_def: completely certain about something
sentences: [ + (that) ] I'm convinced that he's made a mistake.

eng_def: very unhappy, often for a long time
sentences: She has been feeling very depressed since her marriage broke up.
an economically depressed area

eng_def: to experience something unpleasant
sentences: We encountered quite a few problems at the beginning.
She encountered the manager in the hall.

eng_def: how big or important something is
sentences: He hadn't realized the enormity of the problem.
He certainly didn’t shrink from the enormity of the challenge.

eng_def: a feeling that you want to do something
sentences: [ + to do sth ] She showed little inclination to leave.
Has he any inclinations towards engineering?

eng_def: to use a law, rule, etc to support what you are saying or doing
sentences: The President may invoke federal law to stop the strike.
He invoked a little-known federal law.

eng_def: made of or surrounded with panels (usually of wood)
sentences: a panelled door
oak-panelled

eng_def: If an unpleasant feeling or situation persists, it continues to exist.
sentences: If symptoms persist, consult a doctor.
He persists in calling me Jane, even though I've corrected him twice.

eng_def: to cause a problem
sentences: A lot of these chemicals pose very real threats to our health.
The two leaders posed for photographs outside the White House.

eng_def: not wanting to do something
sentences: [ + to do sth ] Many victims of crime are reluctant to go to the police.
[ + to do sth ] a reluctance to accept changes

eng_def: to experience something, especially a change or medical treatment
tr_def: maruz kalmak, geçirmek, başından geçmek, uğramak, katlanmak
sentences: The country is currently undergoing major political change.
He is undergoing surgery for a heart problem.

eng_def: a pause before doing something, especially because you are nervous or not certain
sentences: After a moment's hesitation, he unlocked the door.
He had no hesitation in signing for the team.
Hesitation can cost you dearly when you are a goalkeeper.
